articles.title: Kim Jong Il Takes Photo with Participants in WPK Conference
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Takes Photo with Participants in WPK Conference
Pyongyang, September 29 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il had a photo session with the newly elected members of the central leadership body of the WPK and the participants in the WPK Conference.
					 When he arrived at the plaza of the Kumsusan Memorial Palace, they broke into the rousing cheers of hurrah and loud shouts of slogans "Let Us Protect with Our Lives the WPK Central Committee Headed by Great Comrade Kim Jong Il", "Single-minded Unity!" and "Devoted Defence!" reverberating through the azure sky in September.
					
					 He waved back to the enthusiastically cheering participants, extending a warm salute to them.
					
					 Present there were Kim Yong Nam, Choe Yong Rim and Ri Yong Ho, members of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the WPK Central Committee, Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the WPK Central Military Commission,  Ri Ul Sol and Kim Chol Man, veteran anti-Japanese revolutionary fighters, Kim Yong Chun, Jon Pyong Ho, Kim Kuk Thae, Kim Ki Nam, Choe Thae Bok, Yang Hyong Sop, Kang Sok Ju, Pyon Yong Rip, Ri Yong Mu, Ju Sang Song, Hong Sok Hyong and Kim Kyong Hui, members of the Political Bureau of the WPK Central Committee, Kim Yang Gon, Kim Yong Il, Pak To Chun, Choe Ryong Hae, Jang Song Thaek, Ju Kyu Chang, Ri Thae Nam, Kim Rak Hui, Thae Jong Su, Kim Phyong Hae, U Tong Chuk, Kim Jong Gak, Pak Jong Sun, Kim Chang Sop and Mun Kyong Dok, alternate members of the Political Bureau of the WPK Central Committee. 
					
					 Kim Jong Il warmly congratulated the participants in the Conference who have devotedly worked for the development of the party and the prosperity of the country and had a photo session with them.
					
					 He expressed expectation and belief that the participants in the Conference who have steadfastly followed the road of the revolution, remaining single-mindedly loyal to the party, would play their pioneer's role in the revolution and the construction in the future, too, and thereby creditably perform their honorable mission and duty as vanguard fighters of the party.

articles.title: Congratulations from Hu Jintao
articles.content:
Congratulations from Hu Jintao
Pyongyang, September 29 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, received a congratulatory message from Hu Jintao, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China, on September 28.
					 The message says:
					
					 I, on behalf of the CPC Central Committee and on my own behalf, extend warm congratulations to you on the successful WPK Conference, your reelection as general secretary of the WPK and the election of its supreme leadership body.
					
					 The WPK headed by General Secretary Kim Jong Il has achieved great successes in the cause of building Korean-style socialism through self-reliance and strenuous efforts by leading all the Korean people for many years.
					
					 In recent years the Korean people have made a series of admirable achievements in economic development, improvement of the people's standard of living and other fields to build a great prosperous and powerful nation.
					
					 China and the DPRK maintain deep and traditional friendship and close geographical relationship with wide-ranging common interests.
					
					 It is the steadfast policy of the Chinese party and government to consolidate and develop the Sino-DPRK friendly and cooperative relations.
					
					 We defend and promote the bilateral relationship, always holding fast to it in a strategic view under the long-term discernment no matter how the international situation may change.
					
					 We will strive together with the DPRK side to steadily put the bilateral relations on a new stage and provide greater happiness to the peoples of the two countries and make greater contribution to achieving lasting peace and common prosperity of the region.
					
					 I heartily wish you and the WPK continued and greater fresh successes in the work to build a thriving nation by leading the Korean people.

articles.title: Profiles of Presidium and Members of Political Bureau
articles.content:
Profiles of Presidium and Members of Political Bureau
 Pyongyang, September 29 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the Workers' Party of Korea Central Committee 
					 He was born in the Central District, Pyongyang, on February 4, Juche 17 (1928). After graduating from a university, he worked as a teacher at the Central Party School, vice department director of the WPK Central Committee, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, and first vice department director, department director and secretary of the WPK Central Committee, vice-premier of the Administration Council and concurrently minister of Foreign Affairs. 
					
					 He has worked as president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly since September of Juche 87 (1998). 
					
					 Choe Yong Rim, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK
					
					 He was born on November 20, Juche 19 (1930), in Kyonghung County, North Hamgyong Province.
					
					 He joined the Korean People's Army in July Juche 39 (1950). 
					
					 He got the qualifications as an economic engineer after graduating from a university. 
					
					 He worked as instructor, section chief, vice department director, first vice department director and department director of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea and chief secretary of the Secretaries Office of the Kumsusan Assembly Hall. 
					
					 Then he held posts of vice-premier of the Administration Council, director of the Central Public Prosecutors Office and secretary general of the SPA Presidium. 
					
					 He worked as chief secretary of the Pyongyang City Committee of the WPK until he was appointed as premier of the Cabinet in June Juche 99 (2010).
					
					  Jo Myong Rok, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK.
					
					 Born in Yonsa County, North Hamgyong Province, on July 12, Juche 17 (1928), he joined the Korean People's Army in December of Juche 39 (1950). 
					
					 Graduated from the Aviation School, he worked as battalion commander, regimental commander, divisional commander, chief of staff and commander of the air force of the Korean People's Army and director of the General Political Bureau of the KPA. 
					
					 He has held the post of first vice chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK since February of Juche 98 (2009.)
					
					 Ri Yong Ho, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK
					
					 Born in Thongchon County, Kangwon Province on October 5, Juche 31 (1942), he joined the Korean People's Army in August Juche 48 (1959).
					
					 After graduation from Kim Il Sung Military University he worked as chief of staff of a division, director of the operations department of an army corps, head of a training center, vice-director of the operations department of the General Staff, its deputy chief and head of a training center of the KPA.
					
					 He has worked as chief of the General Staff of the KPA since February of Juche 98 (2009). 
					
					 Kim Yong Chun, member of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea  
					
					 Born in Pochon County, Ryanggang Province on March 4, Juche 25 (1936), he joined the People's Army in July Juche 45 (1956).
					
					 After graduation from Kim Il Sung Military University, he held the posts of deputy director of the operations department of an army corps, chief of staff and director of the Reconnaissance Bureau of the General Staff, deputy chief of the General Staff and director of the Operations Bureau, head of a training centre, director of the General Bureau for Munitions Mobilization, commander of an army corps, chief of the General Staff and vice-chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission.
					
					 He has worked as minister of the People's Armed Forces since February of Juche 98 (2009). 
					
					 Jon Pyong Ho, member of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea
					
					 Born in Jonchon County, Jagang Province, on March 20, Juche 15 (1926), he joined the Worker-Peasant Red Guards in October Juche 34 (1945).
					
					  He graduated from a university, acquiring the qualification as a metal engineering and casting engineer.
					
					 He worked as deputy chief engineer of Factory No. 26, department director of the State Planning Commission, chief engineer of the Kanggye Tractor Plant, vice department director and department director of the C.C., the WPK, vice-chairman and first vice chairman of the Second Economy Commission and chief secretary of its party committee, chairman of the Second Economy Commission, secretary and department director of the C.C., the WPK.  He has worked as director of the Political Bureau of the Cabinet and chief secretary of its party committee since September of Juche 99 (2010.)
					
					 Kim Kuk Thae, member of the Political Bureau of the Workers' Party of Korea Central Committee,
					
					 He was born in Kim Chaek City, North Hamgyong Province, on August 27, Juche 13 (1924.)
					
					 After graduating from the Higher Party School, he worked as instructor, section chief, vice department director and department director of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, vice director of the General Political Bureau of the Korean People's Army, director of the Political Bureau of the Ministry of Public Security, director of Kim Il Sung Higher Party School and department director and secretary of the C.C., the WPK. He has worked as chairman of the Control Commission of the C.C., the WPK since September of Juche 99 (2010). 
					
					 Kim Ki Nam, member of the Political Bureau of the Workers' Party of Korea Central Committee
					
					 He was born in Kumya County, South Hamgyong Province, on August 28, Juche 18 (1929.)
					
					 Graduated from a university acquiring the qualification as an economic expert, he worked as a teacher and a dean of a faculty of Kim Il Sung University, vice department director of the C.C., the WPK, editor-in-chief of Rodong Sinmun, first vice department director, department director and secretary of the C.C, the WPK.
					
					 He has worked as secretary and director of the Information and Publicity Department of the C.C, the WPK from May, Juche 99 (2010.)
					
					 Choe Thae Bok, member of the Political Bureau of the C.C, the WPK
					
					 He was born in Hanggu District, Nampho City, on December 1, Juche 19 (1930).
					
					 After graduating from a university, he worked as a teacher, a dean of a faculty, president of Kim Chaek University of Technology, chairman of the Education Commission and minister of Higher Education. 
					
					 He has worked as secretary of the C.C., the WPK since December of Juche 75 (1986.)
					
					 Yang Hyong Sop, member of the Political Bureau of the C.C, the WPK
					
					 Born in Songchongang District, Hamhung City, South Hamgyong Province on October 1, Juche 14 (1925), he joined the Korean People's Army in June Juche 39 (1950).
					
					 After graduating from Kim Il Sung University, he held the posts of instructor, section chief of the C.C., the WPK, director of the Central Party School, minister of Higher Education, secretary of the C.C., the WPK, president of the Academy of Social Sciences, chairman of the Standing Committee of the Supreme People's Assembly. 
					
					 He has worked as vice-president of the Presidium of the SPA since September of Juche 87 (1998).
					
					 Kang Sok Ju, member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK
					
					 He was born in Phyongwon County, South Phyongan Province on August 29, Juche 28 (1939.)
					
					 After graduating from a university, he worked as instructor of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, instructor and section chief of the C.C., the WPK, vice-minister and first vice-minister of Foreign Affairs.      He has worked as vice-premier of the Cabinet since September of Juche 99 (2010.)
					
					  Pyon Yong Rip, member of the Political Bureau of the C.C, the WPK
					
					  Born in Jaeryong County, South Hwanghae Province on September 20, Juche 18 (1929), he joined the People's Army in September of Juche 39 (1950).
					
					 He graduated from Kim Il Sung University, acquiring the qualification as a physics expert. 
					
					 He worked as head of a department of Kim Il Sung University, director of a department of the Ministry of Higher Education, first vice department director of the Education Commission, vice-president of the State Academy of Sciences, minister of Education and president of the State Academy of Sciences.
					
					 He has worked as secretary general of the Presidium of the SPA since July of Juche 98 (2009.)
					
					 Ri Yong Mu, member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK
					
					 Born in Phyongsong City, South Phyongan Province on January 25, Juche 14 (1925), he joined the Central Guard Battalion in June Juche 36 (1947).
					
					 After graduation from Second Central Political School, he worked as an instructor of the General Political Bureau of the Korean People's Army, director of the political department and commander of a division of the KPA, section chief and deputy director of the organizational department of the General Political Bureau and its first vice director and director, chairman of the State Control Commission, director of the Political Bureau of the Ministry of Public Security, chairman and concurrently director of the Political Bureau of the Transport Commission. 
					
					  He has worked as vice-chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK since September of Juche 87 (1998).
					
					 Ju Sang Song, member of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea 
					
					 Born in Munchon City, Kangwon Province on August 1, Juche 22 (1933), he joined the Korean People's Army in June of Juche 40 (1951).
					
					 After graduating from Kim Il Sung Military University he worked as senior operations staff officer of an army corps, brigade commander, divisional commander, chief of staff of regional headquarters, commander of an army corps and inspector of the General Staff. He has worked as minister of People's Security since July of Juche 93 (2004.)
					
					 Hong Sok Hyong, member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK 
					
					 He was born in Seoul on October 1, Juche 25 (1936). He graduated from a university, acquiring the qualification as an engineer of metal engineering. 
					
					 He worked as vice-chief engineer for technical affairs of the Songjin Steel Works, first vice-minister of Metal Industry, chief engineer of the Kim Chaek Iron and Steel Complex, second secretary of the North Hamgyong Provincial Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea and concurrently chief secretary of the party committee of the said complex, chairman of the State Planning Commission, chief secretary of the provincial committee of the WPK and department director of the WPK Central Committee.
					
					 He has worked as secretary and director of the Department of Planning and Finance of the WPK Central Committee since September of Juche 99 (2010).
					
					 Ri Thae Nam, alternate member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK
					
					 He was born in Yomju County, North Phyongan Province on March 26, Juche 27 (1938). He graduated from Pyongyang University of Mechanical Engineering, acquiring the qualification as a metal processing engineer. 
					
					 He worked as head of a workshop of the Coal Mining Machine Plant, instructor, deputy section chief and section chief of the C.C., the WPK, chief secretary of the Party Committee of the Kangson Steel Complex, chairman of the Nampho City Administrative and Economic Committee, chief secretary of the Party Committee of the Hwanghae Iron and Steel Complex and chief secretary of the provincial committee of the WPK.
					
					 He has worked as vice-premier of the Cabinet since June Juche 99 (2010.)  
					
					 Kim Rak Hui, alternate member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK
					
					 Born in Kaechon City, South Phyongan Province on November 11, Juche 22 (1933). 
					
					 After graduating from the University of National Economics, she worked as management board chairwoman of a cooperative farm, chairwoman of a county cooperative farm management committee, chairwoman of a provincial rural economy committee, vice department director of the WPK Central Committee and chief secretary of the South Hwanghae Provincial Committee of the WPK.
					
					 She has worked as vice-premier of the Cabinet from June Juche 99 (2010). 
					
					 Thae Jong Su, alternate member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK
					
					 Born in Myonggan County, North Hamgyong Province on March 20, Juche 25 (1936).
					
					 Joined the People's Army in September Juche 39 (1950).
					
					 Got qualifications for a machine-building engineer after graduating from a university. 
					
					 He worked as school inspector of the Ministry of Common Education, instructor and section chief of the WPK Central Committee, secretary of a provincial committee of the WPK, manager of a machine-building factory, minister of Shipbuilding Industry, chief secretary of the party committee of the Taean Heavy Machine Complex, vice-premier of the Cabinet, chief secretary of the South Hamgyong Provincial Committee of the WPK and department director of the C.C., WPK.
					
					 He is active as secretary of the WPK Central Committee and director of its General Affairs Department from September Juche 99 (2010). 
					
					 Kim Phyong Hae, alternate member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK
					
					 Born in Jonchon County, Jagang Province on October 8, Juche 30 (1941). 
					
					 Joined the People's Army in February Juche 49 (1960).
					
					 After graduating from a university of education, he worked as instructor, section chief and vice department director of a provincial party committee, instructor of the WPK Central Committee, department director and organizational secretary of a provincial party committee and chief secretary of the North Phyongan Provincial Committee of the WPK.
					
					 He is active as secretary and director of the Personnel Department of the WPK Central Committee from September Juche 99 (2010).
					
					 U Tong Chuk, alternate member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK
					
					 Born in Phyongwon County, South Phyongan Province on August 8, Juche 31 (1942).
					
					 Got qualifications for an expert in philosophy after graduating from Kim Il Sung University.
					
					 He worked as instructor and deputy section chief of the WPK Central Committee and department director and vice-minister of State Security.
					
					 He serves as first vice-minister of State Security from September Juche 98 (2009). 
					
					 Kim Jong Gak, alternate member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK
					
					 Born in Jungsan County, South Phyongan Province on July 20, Juche 30 (1941). 
					
					 Joined the People's Army in August Juche 48 (1959).
					
					 After graduating from Kim Il Sung Military University, he served as battalion commander, deputy commander of an army corps, chief of staff and head of a training center and vice-minister of the People's Armed Forces.
					
					 He has been active as first vice-director of the General Political Bureau of the Korean People's Army since March Juche 96 (2007). 
					
					 Pak Jong Sun, alternate member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK
					
					 Born in Phyongwon County, South Phyongan Province on July 1, Juche 17 (1928).
					
					 Joined the People's Army in July Juche 39 (1950).
					
					 After graduating from the Central Party School, he worked as vice department director of a county party committee, instructor of a provincial party committee, chief instructor of the WPK Central Committee, second secretary of the South Hamgyong Provincial Committee of the WPK, section chief and vice department director of the C.C., WPK, organizational secretary of the Pyongyang City Committee of the WPK and vice department director and department director of the C.C., WPK.
					
					 He serves as first vice director of the Organizational Leadership Department of the C.C., WPK from September Juche 99 (2010). 
					
					 Kim Chang Sop, alternate member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK
					
					 Born in Unsan County, South Phyongan Province on January 2, Juche 35 (1946). 
					
					 Joined the People's Army in July Juche 52 (1963). 
					
					 After graduating from Kim Il Sung Higher Party School, he worked as instructor, chief instructor and deputy section chief of the WPK Central Committee and vice-minister of State Security and vice-director of its Political Bureau.
					
					 He has been active as director of the Political Bureau of the Ministry of State Security since August Juche 98 (2009). 
					
					 Mun Kyong Dok, alternate member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK 
					
					 Born in Taesong District, Pyongyang on October 12, Juche 46 (1957). 
					
					 Joined the People's Army in October Juche 62 (1973).
					
					 After graduating from Kim Il Sung University he got qualifications for a political economist.
					
					 He worked as instructor of the Pyongyang City Committee of the WPK, vice-chairman of the C.C., the League of Socialist Working Youth of Korea, director of the Guidance Bureau No. 2, vice department director of the WPK Central Committee and chief secretary of the Pyongyang City Committee of the WPK.
					
					 He is active as secretary of the WPK Central Committee and concurrently chief secretary of the Pyongyang City Committee of the WPK from September Juche 99 (2010).
					
					 Kim Yang Gon, alternate member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK
					
					 Born in Anju City, South Phyongan Province on April 24, Juche 31 (1942).
					
					 Joined the People's Army in August Juche 48 (1959).
					
					 Got qualifications for an expert in French language and literature after graduating from Kim Il Sung University. 
					
					 He had been active as instructor of the C.C., the League of Socialist Working Youth of Korea and instructor, section chief, vice department director and department director of the WPK Central Committee.
					
					 He works as secretary of the WPK Central Committee and director of its United Front Department from September Juche 99 (2010).
					
					 Kim Yong Il, alternate member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK
					
					 Born in Jongju City, North Phyongan Province on March 17, Juche 36 (1947).
					
					 After graduating from the University of International Relations he worked as instructor of the WPK Central Committee, director and vice-minister of Foreign Affairs and department director of the C.C., WPK.
					
					 He is active as secretary of the WPK Central Committee and concurrently director of its International Affairs Department from September Juche 99 (2010).
					
					 Pak To Chun, alternate member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK
					
					 Born in Rangrim County, Jagang Province on March 9, Juche 33 (1944).
					
					 Joined the People's Army in October Juche 49 (1960).
					
					 After graduating from Kim Il Sung Higher Party School he worked as secretary of a mine party committee, instructor, deputy section chief and section chief of the WPK Central Committee, secretary and department director of a provincial party committee and chief secretary of the Jagang Provincial Committee of the WPK.
					
					 He serves as secretary of the WPK Central Committee from September Juche 99 (2010).
					
					 Choe Ryong Hae, alternate member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK
					
					 Born in Sinchon County, South Hwanghae Province on January 15, Juche 39 (1950). 
					
					 Joined the People's Army in September Juche 56 (1967). 
					
					 Got qualifications for a political economist after graduating from Kim Il Sung University. 
					
					 He worked as vice department director, department director and vice-chairman of the C.C., the League of Socialist Working Youth of Korea, first secretary of the C.C., the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League, vice department director of the WPK Central Committee and chief secretary of the North Hwanghae Provincial Committee of the WPK.
					
					 He is active as secretary of the WPK Central Committee from September Juche 99 (2010). 
					
					 Jang Song Thaek, alternate member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK
					
					 Born in Chongam District, Chongjin City of North Hamgyong Province on January 22, Juche 35 (1946). 
					
					 After graduating from Kim Il Sung University he worked as instructor of the Pyongyang City Committee of the WPK and instructor, deputy section chief, section chief, vice department director, first vice department director and department director of the C.C., the WPK.
					
					 He has been active as vice-chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission and director of the Administration Department of the WPK Central Committee since June Juche 99 (2010).
					
					 Ju Kyu Chang, alternate member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK
					
					 Born in Hamju County, South Hamgyong Province on November 25, Juche 17 (1928).
					
					 Joined the People's Army in March Juche 39 (1950).
					
					 Got qualifications for a mechanical engineer after graduating from a university.
					
					 He worked as vice-president, first vice-president and president of the Academy of National Defence Science, vice department director of the WPK Central Committee, chairman of the Second Economy Commission, president of the Second Academy of Natural Science and first vice department director of the WPK Central Committee.
					
					 He is active as director of the Department of Machine-Building Industry of the WPK Central Committee from September Juche 99 (2010).

articles.title: Meeting of KPA Servicepersons Held
articles.content:
Meeting of KPA Servicepersons Held
 Pyongyang, September 29 (KCNA) -- A meeting of servicepersons of the three services of the Korean People's Army was held at Jonsung Square Wednesday to congratulate Supreme Commander Kim Jong Il on his reelection as general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					 Present there were Kim Yong Chun and other leading officials of the Ministry of the People's Armed Forces and KPA servicepersons.
					
					 Kim Yong Chun, minister of the People's Armed Forces, addressed the meeting to be followed by general officers.
					
					 The speakers said that Kim Jong Il's reelection as general secretary of the WPK, organizer and guide of all victories of the Korean people, marks a great political event in the efforts to further strengthen the WPK and bring earlier the final victory in the revolutionary cause of Juche.
					
					 Kim Jong Il has led the party and army to one victory after another for decades with his unique Songun politics, thus developing the WPK into an eternal glorious party of President Kim Il Sung and ushering in a great heyday of the country's prosperity and army building, they noted, adding that these undying feats would shine forever.
					
					 They called on all the servicepersons of the KPA to defend the Party Central Committee headed by Kim Jong Il with their lives, enshrining the fixed faith and will that eternal prosperity is in store for Kim Il Sung's Korea and ever-lasting happiness for the Korean people as they are led by Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 Rosy is the future of Kim Il Sung's Korea thanks to the guidance of the ever-victorious WPK led by Kim Jong Il, the might of all the servicepersons and people single-mindedly united around the Party and the invincible revolutionary armed forces, they declared, calling for waging a more dynamic struggle to achieve the reunification of the country and accomplish the revolutionary cause of Juche.
					
					 A dancing party of servicepersons of the three services of the KPA took place there to congratulate Kim Jong Il on his reelection as general secretary of the WPK on the same day.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets Botswana President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets Botswana President
 Pyongyang, September 29 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Tuesday sent a message of greetings to Seretse Khama Ian Khama, president of Botswana, on the occasion of the 44th anniversary of its independence.
					 The message expressed belief that the relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would grow stronger in the future, wishing the president greater success in his work for the country's prosperity and people's well-being.

articles.title: Pak Kil Yon Addresses at Annual Meeting of NAM
articles.content:
Pak Kil Yon Addresses at Annual Meeting of NAM
 Pyongyang, September 29 (KCNA) -- Vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs Pak Kil Yon, who headed the DPRK delegation to the 65th meeting of the UN General Assembly, made an address at an annual meeting of NAM Foreign Ministers that was held on the sidelines of the general assembly on Sept. 27.
					 The agenda of the meeting reflected the common will of the member nations to intensify the non-aligned movement at present, he said, clarifying opinion on it.
					
					 NAM should strengthen the support and solidarity with the member nations in their efforts for defending sovereignty, he said, underscoring the need to increase the movement's ability of taking collective action on the UN arena.
					
					 The developments on the Korean Peninsula are arousing great concerns among the member nations of the NAM and the world, he said, and continued:
					
					 The reality is a clear reminder of the validity of DPRK's access to a powerful war deterrent and the urgency of establishing peace mechanism on the peninsula.
					
					 The DPRK proposed parties to the Korean Armistice Agreement to hold talks for replacing the AA with a peace accord this year, six decades since the outbreak of the Korean war.
					
					 The proposal for concluding the peace agreement was aimed to remove the root cause of posing constant threat to the peace and stability of the region and establish durable peace mechanism on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 He expressed expectation that the member nations of the NAM would correctly understand the essence of the grave situation prevailing on the peninsula and extend firm support and solidarity to the Korean people in their efforts to defend the sovereignty of the country and the fundamental idea of the NAM in the future, too.

articles.title: WPK Hosts Reception for Finnish Party Delegation
articles.content:
WPK Hosts Reception for Finnish Party Delegation
 Pyongyang, September 29 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea hosted a reception in honor of the visiting delegation of the Communist Workers' Party of Finland for the Peace and Socialism at Pyongyang Koryo Hotel on Wednesday.
					 Present there on invitation were the delegation headed by Chairman Hannu Harju.
					
					 On hand were Secretary of the WPK Central Committee Kim Yong Il and its officials.
					
					 Kim in his speech referred to the fact that the two parties have closely cooperated with each other in the effort for independence and socialism against imperialism long ago.
					
					 He highly praised the Communist Workers' Party of Finland for the Peace and Socialism for invariably maintaining the revolutionary principle.
					
					 The WPK will make strenuous efforts to develop the friendly relations between the two parties in the future, too, he stressed.
					
					Hannu Harju said in his speech that he warmly congratulates General Secretary Kim Jong Il on his reelection as general secretary of the WPK at its Conference.
					
					 Referring to the fact that the publication of the June 15 joint declaration put spurs to the accomplishment of the Korean people's cause of reunification, he stressed that he deeply sympathized with the constructive proposal for reunification advanced by President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Expressing his party's support for the Songun politics enforced by Kim Jong Il, he expressed his will to  strive hard to develop the relations between the two parties.

articles.title: Reception Given to Mark Birthday of China
articles.content:
Reception Given to Mark Birthday of China
 Pyongyang, September 29 (KCNA) -- Liu Hongcai, Chinese ambassador to the DPRK, hosted a reception at the Taedonggang Diplomatic Corps Club on Wednesday on the occasion of the 61st anniversary of the founding of the People's Republic of China.
					 Present there on invitation were Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, Kim Song Nam, vice department director of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea, Pak Jae Gyong, vice-minister of the People's Armed Forces, and officials concerned and diplomatic envoys and embassy officials here. On hand were staff members of the Chinese embassy here and Chinese guests staying in the DPRK.
					
					Liu Hongcai in his speech made at the reception noted that the Conference of the WPK was successfully held and General Secretary Kim Jong Il was reelected as general secretary of the WPK, adding that General Secretary Hu Jintao expressed his words of congratulations through his congratulatory message.
					
					 He expressed hope that the Korean people under the leadership of the WPK headed by Kim Jong Il would register greater success in their efforts to develop economy and improve the standards of their living.
					
					 Noting that it is the consistent policy of the Chinese party and government to steadily boost the Sino-DPRK friendly and cooperative relations, he said that China would join Korean comrades in putting the Sino-DPRK relations on a high stage.
					
					 Yang Hyong Sop in his speech noted that the Chinese people built a socialist state with the Chinese characteristics in the vast Chinese territory through strenuous struggle for the past 61 years.
					
					 Noting that the Chinese people have achieved many successes in an effort to carry out the scientific outlook on development and build a harmonious socialist society under the leadership of the Communist Party of China with Hu Jintao as its general secretary.
					
					 He reiterated the consistent stand of the WPK and the government of the DPRK to steadily consolidate and develop the traditional DPRK-China friendly and cooperative relations, expressing belief that the traditional bilateral relations of friendship and cooperation would grow stronger in the spirit of the agreement reached between the top leaders of the two countries.

articles.title: Floral Basket from Japanese Delegation
articles.content:
Floral Basket from Japanese Delegation
 Pyongyang, September 29 (KCNA) -- The visiting delegation of the Japanese Society for Consultation on Korean Affairs presented a basket of flowers to General Secretary Kim Jong Il in congratulation of his reelection as general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					 The basket was conveyed to an official concerned on Wednesday by Kazuyoshi Hishiki, professor emeritus of Hiroshima Shudo University of Japan who is heading the delegation.
					
					 Meanwhile he was presented with a floral basket by Nada Takashi, chairman of the Ehime, Japan, prefectural preparatory committee for commemorating the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung, on the same occasion.
					
					 The floral basket was delivered to an official concerned.

articles.title: Japanese Delegation Here
articles.content:
Japanese Delegation Here
 Pyongyang, September 29 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Liaison Society for the Normalization of the Relations between Japan and the DPRK led by Co-representative Sumiko Shimizu arrived here Wednesday.

articles.title: DPRK Wins Gold at Int'l Boxers Championships
articles.content:
DPRK Wins Gold at Int'l Boxers Championships
 Pyongyang, September 29 (KCNA) -- DPRK players proved successful at the 14th International Boxing Masters Championships in Kazakhstan from Sept. 17 to 21.
					 Pak Jong Chol bagged a gold medal in the 52kg category event.
					
					 Sung Song Guk garnered a silver medal in the 49kg category event and Ri Myong Son a bronze medal in the 56kg category event.

articles.title: Clinic for Synchronized Swimming Coaches Held
articles.content:
Clinic for Synchronized Swimming Coaches Held 
 Pyongyang, September 29 (KCNA) -- A FINA clinic for synchronized swimming coaches took place in Pyongyang from September 23 to 27. 
					 The clinic, which was held, divided into theoretical and practical courses at the Sports Science Library and the swimming pool of the Changgwang Health Complex, was participated in by coaches of local sports teams and teachers of juvenile sports schools. 
					
					It dealt with some changed regulations, refereeing methods, basic technical training of players, etc.
					
					 It was given by UIIa Lucenius, a FINA lecturer.

articles.title: Scientists, Technicians Play Big Role in Economic Development
articles.content:
Scientists, Technicians Play Big Role in Economic Development
 Pyongyang, September 29 (KCNA) -- The February 17 Shock Brigade of Scientists and Technicians is playing a big role in improving the people's living and developing the economy.
					 Scientists and technicians belonging to the shock brigade have found themselves in scores of major industrial establishments and co-op farms throughout the country to give them a scientific and technological assistance in their effort for increased production and technological updating.
					
					 Teachers and researchers of Kim Il Sung University, Kim Chaek University of Technology and other universities have made a contribution to raising the combustion efficiency of boilers, prolonging the serviceable life of the equipment and putting the production processes on IT basis at the Pyongyang Thermal Power Complex.
					
					 Those dispatched to major collieries and mines in Sunchon, Tanchon and other areas have improved the tunneling, mining and coal hewing methods to suit their coal fields and mineral deposits, introducing lots of technological innovations in production.
					
					 With the help of the shock brigade, a new model of electric locomotive has been developed, the production of rolling stocks increased and the traffic control system modernized.
					
					 In the agricultural sector a production system and scientific cultivating methods of new high-yield rice strains have been established and a research into a reasonable combination of stockbreeding with crops farming with the use of man-made pastures and various kinds of assorted feed has been made to consolidate material and technological foundations for boosting the agricultural production.

articles.title: Society Formed in Japan
articles.content:
Society Formed in Japan
 Pyongyang, September 29 (KCNA) -- The Society for Questioning about State Responsibility for Massacres of Koreans during the Great Kanto Earthquake was formed with due ceremony in Tokyo on Sept. 24.  
					 Present there were Japanese figures and citizens from different parts of Japan. 
					
					 Shoji Yamata, honorary professor at Rikkyo University, in his report referred to the information he obtained through his study and new findings made recently. He pointed in detail to the facts that at that time the Japanese government not only faked up and spread groundless rumors that Koreans rose in a riot but hurled army, police, vigilante corps and other forces into killing Koreans. 
					
					 He laid bare the ceaseless crimes committed by the State of Japan in the wake of the earthquake; it not only covered up the truth about the mass killings of Koreans by describing them as excesses done by some persons but brutally cracked down upon protests against the massacres of Koreans and memorial services for the slain Koreans conducted by Koreans in Japan and Japanese. 
					
					 The participants of the ceremony discussed and decided on the tasks facing the above-said society to conduct activities urging the Japanese government to recognize the responsibility for the above-mentioned massacres of Koreans and apologize for them and take necessary steps for them, inquire into the victims of the massacres and their bereaved families and open to the public the results of the inquiry into the massacres and information about them, etc. 
					
					 Co-representatives and director of the secretariat of the society were elected at the ceremony.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Successful Visit to China Hailed
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Successful Visit to China Hailed
Pyongyang, September 29 (KCNA) -- The Franken Group for the Study of the Juche Idea of Germany issued a statement on Sept. 23 in congratulation of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's successful visit to China.
					 The statement noted that the China visit paid by Kim Jong Il in August after his visit to China in May was a historic occasion that brilliantly decorated the chapter of the DPRK-China friendship.
					
					 This was an expression of Kim Jong Il's steadfast will to further exalt generation after generation the tradition of the DPRK-China friendship provided by President Kim Il Sung and Chairman Mao Zedong, it held.
					
					 It noted that Kim Jong Il's visit to China proved once again the efforts of the party, government and people of the DPRK to preserve the peace and defuse the tension on the Korean Peninsula and the rest of Northeast Asia.

articles.title: DPRK's Important Days Celebrated
articles.content:
DPRK's Important Days Celebrated
 Pyongyang, September 29 (KCNA) -- A seminar was held in Russia and a meeting in UK on Sept. 17 and 18 on the occasions of the 62nd anniversary of the founding of the DPRK and the 65th anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					Gennadi Astakhov, chief of the Tynda City Group for the Study of the Juche Idea of Russian Philosophy Association, in a report said that the DPRK is exercising its sovereignty with dignity on the international arena thanks to the Juche idea founded by President Kim Il Sung and the Songun politics enforced by General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Thanks to the great Songun politics, peace has been preserved on the Korean Peninsula and the drive for building a thriving nation has been successfully carried out in the DPRK, he noted.
					
					 Dermot Hudson, representative of the British Branch of the Korean Friendship Association headquartered in Spain, in a report highly praised the President for his feats of party-building and nation-building and Kim Jong Il for developing the WPK into the glorious party of Kim Il Sung and the DPRK into the socialist state of Juche with the invincible might.
					
					 The WPK will lead the Korean people along the road of the victory and glory under the leadership of Kim Jong Il in the future, too, he stressed.
					
					 Kevin Cain, organizational secretary of the British branch, and other speakers noted that the U.S. imperialists and their followers including the south Korean puppet forces have persistently committed the moves against the DPRK by mobilizing all means, but the DPRK has remained undeterred. There is no such genuine socialist country as the DPRK in the world, he added.

articles.title: Story of Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Story of Kim Il Sung
 Pyongyang, September 29 (KCNA) -- One April day in Juche 35 (1946) President Kim Il Sung visited then Anju County, South Phyongan Province.
					 The President told officials and peasants of the county that he had come to solve the water shortage of the Yoldusamcholli Plain, saying he had always been worried about the peasants' great deal of trouble over agricultural water.
					
					 He then said that the Phyongnam irrigation project had been planned to water the plain involving tens of thousands of hectares in Anju and Phyongwon counties and realize the peasants' longing for water.
					
					 After the project was launched, he gave field guidance to it several times for its successful completion. 
					
					 Since the completion of the project, the peasants have done farming, not worried about water shortage.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il recibe mensaje de Hu Jintao
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il recibe mensaje de Hu Jintao
						
Pyongyang, 29 de septiembre (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, recibio un mensaje de felicitacion que le enviara el dia 28 Hu Jintao, Secretario General del Comite Central del Partido Comunista de China.
					  La misiva senala como sigue:
					
					  En representacion del CC del PCCh y en mi nombre, felicito calidamente a usted por la celebracion exitosa de la Conferencia del PTC, su eleccion como Secretario General del PTC y la eleccion del maximo organo directivo.
					
					  Durante largo tiempo, el PTC encabezado por el Secretario General Kim Jong Il logro grandes exitos en el cumplimiento de la causa de construccion del socialismo al estilo coreano al dirigir a todo el pueblo coreano apoyandose en las fuerzas propias y luchando tenazmente.
					
					  En los ultimos anos, el pueblo coreano alcanzo una serie de exitos alentadores en el desarrollo economico, la mejora de la vida del pueblo y otras esferas para construir una gran potencia prospera.
					
					  China y Corea, estos dos paises tienen la amistad tradicional, estrechas relaciones geograficas y amplios intereses comunes.
					
					  Consolidar y desarrollar las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre China y Corea son la orientacion invariable del partido y el gobierno de China.
					
					  Sea como fuera la situacion internacional, mantenemos, defendemos y promovemos invariablemente las relaciones China-Corea desde el punto de vista estrategico y con la vision a largo plazo.
					
					  Nos esforzaremos junto con la parte coreana por hacer mas felices a los pueblos de los dos paises al llevar constantemente a la nueva etapa las relaciones bilaterales y contribuiremos mucho mas al logro de la paz permanente de la region y la prosperidad comun.
					
					  Deseo de todo corazon al camarada Secretario General y al PTC que logren continuamente mayores y nuevos exitos en los trabajos para construir una gran potencia prospera dirigiendo al pueblo coreano.

articles.title: Biografias de los Presidium, miembros y miembros suplentes del BP del PTC
articles.content:
Biografias de los Presidium, miembros y miembros suplentes del BP del PTC
 Pyongyang, 29 de septiembre (ATCC) -- Kim Yong Nam, miembro del Presidium del Buro Politico del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea
					Nacio el 4 de febrero del 17 (1928) de la Era Juche en el municipio Jung de la ciudad de Pyongyang.
					
					  Despues de graduarse de la universidad, trabajo de profesor de la Escuela Central del Partido, subjefe de departamento del CC del PTC, viceministro de Relaciones Exteriores, primer subjefe y jefe de departamento y secretario, del CC del PTC, vicepremier del Consejo de Administracion y ministro de RR.EE.
					
					Desde septiembre del 87 (1998) de la Era Juche, es presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema. 
					
					
					
					Choe Yong Rim, miembro del Presidium del Buro Politico
					
					Nacio el 20 de noviembre del 19 (1930) de la Era Juche en el distrito de Kyonghung de la provincia de Hamgyong del Norte.
					
					Ingreso en el Ejercito Popular de Corea en julio del 39 (1950) de la Era Juche.
					
					Al graduarse de la universidad, obtuvo la licenciatura de economista.
					
					Trabajo de funcionario, jefe de seccion, y subjefe, primer subjefe y jefe de departamento del CC del PTC, secretario directivo de la secretaria del Palacio de las Convenciones Kumsusan, viceprimer ministro del Consejo de Administracion, presidente de la Fiscalia Central, secretario del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema y secretario responsable del Comite del PTC en la Ciudad de Pyongyang.
					
					Es premier del Consejo de Ministros desde junio del 99 (2010) de la Era Juche. 
					
					
					
					Jo Myong Rok, miembro del Presidium del Buro Politico 
					
					El nacio el 12 de julio del 17 (1928) de la Era Juche en el distrito de Yonsa de la provincia de Hamgyong del Norte y se alisto en el Ejercito Popular de Corea en diciembre del 39 (1950) de la Era Juche.
					
					  Despues de graduarse de la Escuela de Aviacion, trabajo de jefe de batallon, de regimiento y de division, jefe del Estado Mayor y comandante de las Fuerzas Aereas y jefe de la Direccion Politica General del EPC. 
					
					Desde febrero del 98 (2009) de la Era Juche, es primer vicepresidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional. 
					
					
					
					Ri Yong Ho, miembro del Presidium del Buro Politico
					
					El nacio el 5 de octubre del 31 (1942) de la Era Juche en el distrito de Thongchon de la provincia de Kangwon.
					
					Se incorporo al Ejercito Popular de Corea en agosto del 48 (1959) de la Era Juche.
					
					Despues de graduarse de la Academia General Militar Kim Il Sung, trabajo de jefe del Estado Mayor de la division, jefe de seccion de operaciones del cuerpo, jefe del Estado Mayor del centro de entrenamiento, subjefe del Departamento de Operaciones y subjefe del Estado Mayor General, y jefe del centro de entrenamiento.
					
					Desde febrero del 98 (2009) de la Era Juche trabaja de jefe del Estado Mayor General del EPC. 
					
					
					
					Kim Yong Chun, miembro del Buro Politico
					
					El nacio el 4 de marzo del 25 (1936) de la Era Juche en el distrito de Pochon de la provincia de Ryanggang.
					
					  Se incorporo al Ejercito Popular de Corea en julio del 45 (1956) de la Era Juche.
					
					  Despues de graduarse de la Academia General Militar Kim Il Sung, trabajo de subjefe de la seccion de operaciones del cuerpo, jefe del estado mayor del departamento de exploracion y jefe del mismo, subjefe del Estado Mayor General y jefe del departamento de operaciones del mismo, jefe del centro de entrenamiento, director general de la movilizacion de materiales belicos, comandante del cuerpo, jefe del Estado Mayor General y vicepresidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional.
					
					  Desde febrero del 98 (2009) de la Era Juche, es ministro de las Fuerzas Armadas Populares.
					
					
					
					Jon Pyong Ho, miembro del Buro Politico
					
					Nacio el 20 de marzo del 15 (1926) de la Era Juche en el distrito de Jonchon de la provincia de Jagang.
					
					En octubre del 34 (1945) de la Era Juche, se incorporo a la Guardia Roja.
					
					Al graduarse de la universidad, recibio el titulo de ingeniero de metalurgia y colada.
					
					Trabajo de sustituto del ingeniero-jefe de la Fabrica no. 26, jefe de departamento del Comite Estatal de Planificacion, ingeniero-jefe de la Fabrica de Tractores de Kanggye, subjefe y jefe de departamento del CC del PTC, vicepresidente, primer vicepresidente y secretario responsable del partido y presidente del Comite de la Economia no. 2, secretario y jefe de departamento del CC del PTC.
					
					Desde septiembre del 99 (2010) de la Era Juche, trabaja de jefe de la Direccion Politica y secretario responsable del comite del partido en el Consejo de Ministros.
					
					
					
					Kim Kuk Thae, miembro del Buro Politico
					
					El  nacio el 27 de agosto del 13 (1924) de la Era Juche en la ciudad de Kim Chaek de la provincia de Hamgyong del Norte.
					
					  Despues de graduado de la Escuela Superior del Partido, trabajo de funcionario, jefe de seccion, subjefe y jefe de departamento, del CC del PTC, subjefe de la Direccion Politica General del Ejercito Popular de Corea, jefe de la Direccion Politica del Ministerio de Seguridad Publica, director de la Escuela Superior del Partido Kim Il Sung, jefe de departamento y secretario del CC del PTC.
					
					Desde septiembre del 99 (2010) de la Era Juche, es presidente de la Comision Central de Control del PTC. 
					
					
					
					Kim Ki Nam, miembro del Buro Politico
					
					El nacio el 28 de agosto del 18 (1929) de la Era Juche en el distrito de Kumya de la provincia de Hamgyong del Sur.
					
					  Al graduarse de la universidad, recibio la licenciatura de economista.
					
					  Trabajo de profesor y decano de la Universidad Kim Il Sung, subjefe de departamento del CC del PTC, editor jefe del Periodico Rodong Sinmun, primer subjefe y jefe de departamento y secretario, del CC del PTC.
					
					  Desde mayo del 99 (2010) de la Era Juche, es secretario y jefe del Departamento de Propaganda y Agitacion del CC del PTC.
					
					
					
					Choe Thae Bok, miembro del Buro Politico 
					
					Nacio el primero de diciembre del 19 (1930) de la Era Juche en el municipio de Hanggu de la ciudad de Nampho.
					
					  Despues de graduado de la universidad, trabajo de profesor, decano y rector de la Universidad Politecnica Kim Chaek, presidente del Comite de Educacion y ministro de Educacion Superior.
					
					  Desde diciembre del 75 (1986) de la Era Juche, es secretario del CC del PTC.
					
					
					
					Yang Hyong Sop, miembro del Buro Politico
					
					El nacio el dia primero de octubre del 14 (1925) de la Era Juche en el municipio de Songchongang de la ciudad de Hamhung de la provincia de Hamgyong del Sur e ingreso en junio del 39 (1950) de la Era Juche en el Ejercito Popular de Corea.
					
					  Despues de graduado de la Universidad            Kim Il Sung trabajo de funcionario, jefe de seccion,  del CC del PTC, de director de la Escuela Central del Partido, ministro de Educacion Superior, secretario del CC del PTC, presidente de la Academia de Ciencias Sociales y presidente del Comite Permanente de la Asamblea Popular Suprema.
					
					  Desde septiembre del 87 (1998) de la Era Juche es el vicepresidente del Presidium de la APS. 
					
					
					
					Kang Sok Ju, miembro del Buro Politico
					
					El nacio el 29 de agosto del 28 (1939) de la Era Juche en el distrito de Phyongwon de la provincia de Phyong-an del Sur.
					
					Despues de graduado de la universidad, trabajo de funcionario del MINREX, funcionario y jefe de seccion del CC del PTC, vicecanciller y primer vicecanciller.
					
					 A partir de septiembre del 99 (2010) de la Era Juche, es viceprimer ministro del Consejo de Ministros. 
					
					
					
					Pyon Yong Rip, miembro del Buro Politico
					
					Nacio el 20 de septiembre del 18 (1929) de la Era Juche en el distrito de Jaeryong de la provincia de Hwanghae del Sur.
					
					Se incorporo en septiembre del 39 (1950) de la Era Juche al Ejercito Popular de Corea.
					
					Al graduarse de la Universidad Kim Il Sung, ha sido calificado como especialista en la fisica.
					
					Trabajo de jefe de catedra de la Universidad      Kim Il Sung, jefe de departamento del Ministerio de Educacion Superior, primer viceministro del Comite de Educacion, vicepresidente de la Academia Estatal de Ciencias, ministro de Educacion y presidente de la Academia Estatal de Ciencias.
					
					Desde julio del 98 (2009) de la Era Juche, es secretario del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema.
					
					
					
					Ri Yong Mu, miembro del Buro Politico
					
					Nacio el 25 de enero del 14 (1925) de la Era Juche en la ciudad de Phyongsong de la provincia de Phyong-an del Sur y se alisto en junio del 36 (1947) de la Era Juche en el batallon de guardia central.
					
					  Despues de graduado de la Escuela Politica Central no.2, trabajo de funcionario de la Direccion Politica General, jefe de departamento politico de la division, jefe de la division, jefe de seccion de organizacion y subjefe de organizacion, primer subjefe y jefe, de la Direccion Politica General, presidente del Comite Estatal de Control, jefe de la Direccion Politica del Ministerio de Seguridad Publica, presidente y jefe de la Direccion Politica del Comite Estatal de Transporte.
					
					  Desde septiembre del 87 (1998) de la Era Juche, es el vicepresidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional.  
					
					
					
					Ju Sang Song, miembro del Buro Politico
					
					Nacio el primero de agosto del 22 (1933) de la Era Juche en la ciudad de Munchon de la provincia de Kangwon.
					
					Se alisto al Ejercito Popular de Corea en junio del 40 (1951) de la Era Juche.
					
					Despues de graduado de la Academia General Militar Kim Il Sung, trabajo de oficial superior de operaciones del estado mayor del cuerpo, jefe de brigada, jefe de division, jefe del estado mayor de la comandancia de la zona militar, comandante del cuerpo e inspector del Estado Mayor General del EPC.
					
					Es ministro de Seguridad del Pueblo desde julio del 93 (2004) de la Era Juche.
					
					
					
					Hong Sok Hyong, miembro del Buro Politico
					
					Nacio el primero de octubre del 25 (1936) de la Era Juche en la ciudad de Seul.
					
					  Despues de graduado de la universidad, recibio el titulo de ingeniero de metalurgia.
					
					  Trabajo de sustituto del ingeniero en jefe de la Aceria de Songjin encargado de asuntos tecnicos, primer viceministro de Industria Metalurgica, ingeniero en jefe del Complejo Siderurgico Kim Chaek, segundo secretario del Comite del PTC en la Provincia de Hamgyong del Norte y secretario responsable del Comite del PTC en el citado complejo, presidente del Comite Estatal de Planificacion, secretario responsable del Comite del PTC en la Provincia de Hamgyong del Norte y jefe de departamento del CC del PTC.
					
					  Desde septiembre del 99 (2010) de la Era Juche, es secretario y jefe del Departamento de Planificacion y Finanzas del CC del PTC. 
					
					
					
					Ri Thae Nam, miembro suplente del Buro Politico 
					
					Nacio el 26 de marzo del 27 (1938) de la Era Juche en el distrito de Yomju de la provincia de Phyong-an del Norte.
					
					Al graduarse de la Universidad de Maquinaria de Pyongyang, se ha calificado como ingeniero de la elaboracion de metales.
					
					Trabajo de jefe de taller de la Fabrica de Maquinas de Minas de Carbon, funcionario, subjefe y jefe de seccion del CC del PTC, secretario responsable del Comite del PTC en el Complejo de Acero Kangson, presidente del Comite de Administracion y Economia de la ciudad de Nampho, secretario responsable del Comite del PTC en el Complejo Siderurgico Hwanghae y secretario responsable del Comite Provincial del PTC.
					
					Desde junio del 99 (2010) de la Era Juche, es vicepremier del Consejo de Ministros.
					
					
					
					Kim Rak Hui, miembro suplente del Buro Politico
					
					Nacio el 11 de noviembre del 22 (1933) de la Era Juche en la ciudad de Kaechon de la provincia de Phyong-an del Sur.
					
					  Despues de graduada de la Universidad de la Economia Nacional, trabajo de presidenta de la junta administrativa de una granja cooperativa, presidenta del Comite Distrital de Gestion de Granjas Cooperativas, presidenta del Comite Provincial de la Economia Rural, subjefa de departamento del CC del PTC y secretaria responsable del Comite del PTC en la Provincia de Hwanghae del Sur.
					
					Desde junio del 99 (2010) de la Era Juche, es vicepremier del Consejo de Ministros.
					
					
					
					Thae Jong Su, miembro suplente del Buro Politico 
					
					Nacio el 20 de marzo del 25 (1936) de la Era Juche en el distrito de Myonggan de la provincia de Hamgyong del Norte.
					
					  En septiembre del 39 (1950) de la Era Juche, ingreso en el Ejercito Popular de Corea.
					
					Despues de graduado de la universidad, recibio el titulo de ingeniero de maquinaria.
					
					Trabajo de inspector del Ministerio de Educacion General, funcionario y jefe de seccion del CC del PTC, secretario del comite provincial del PTC, gerente de la fabrica mecanica, ministro de Industria Naval, secretario responsable del Comite del PTC en el Complejo de Maquinaria Pesada de Taean, vicepremier del Consejo de Ministros, secretario responsable del Comite del PTC en la Provincia de Hamgyong del Sur y jefe de departamento del CC del PTC.
					
					Desde septiembre del 99 (2010) de la Era Juche, es secretario y jefe del Departamento de Asuntos Generales del CC del PTC. 
					
					
					
					Kim Phyong Hae, miembro suplente del Buro Politico 
					
					Nacio el 8 de octubre del 30 (1941) de la Era Juche en el distrito de Jonchon de la provincia de Jagang.
					
					  Ingreso en febrero del 49 (1960) de la Era Juche en el Ejercito Popular de Corea.
					
					  Despues de graduado de la universidad pedagogica, trabajo de funcionario, jefe de seccion y subjefe de departamento del comite provincial del PTC, funcionario del CC del PTC, jefe de departamento y secretario de organizacion del comite provincial del PTC y secretario responsable del Comite del PTC en la Provincia de Phyong-an del Norte.
					
					Desde septiembre del 99 (2010) de la Era Juche, es secretario y jefe del Departamento del Personal del CC del PTC.
					
					
					
					U Tong Chuk, miembro suplente del Buro Politico
					
					Nacio el 8 de agosto del 31 (1942) de la Era Juche en el distrito de Phyongwon de la provincia de Phyong-an del Sur.
					
					  Al graduarse de la Universidad Kim Il Sung, se hizo licenciado en filosofia.
					
					  Trabajo de funcionario y subjefe de seccion del CC del PTC, director y viceministro de Seguridad Estatal.
					
					  Desde septiembre del 98 (2009) de la Era Juche,  es primer viceministro de Seguridad Estatal.
						
					
					  Kim Jong Gak, miembro suplente del Buro Politico 
					
					Nacio el 20 de julio del 30 (1941) de la Era Juche en el distrito de Jungsan de la provincia de Phyong-an del Sur.
					
					  Se alisto en agosto del 48 (1959) de la Era Juche en el Ejercito Popular de Corea.
					
					  Despues de graduado de la Academia General Militar Kim Il Sung, trabajo de jefe de batallon, vicecomandante del cuerpo, jefe del estado mayor y director del centro de entrenamiento y viceministro de las Fuerzas Armadas Populares.
					
					  Desde marzo del 96 (2007) de la Era Juche, es primer subjefe de la Direccion Politica General del EPC.
						
					
					  Pak Jong Sun, miembro suplente del Buro Politico
					
					Nacio el primero de julio del 17 (1928) de la Era Juche en el distrito de Phyongwon de la provincia de Phyong-an del Sur.
					
					  Ingreso en julio del 39 (1950) de la Era Juche en el Ejercito Popular de Corea.
					
					  Despues de graduado de la Escuela Central del Partido, trabajo de subjefe de departamento del comite distrital del PTC, funcionario del comite provincial del PTC, funcionario responsable del CC del PTC, segundo secretario del Comite del PTC en la Provincia de Hamgyong del Sur, jefe de seccion y subjefe de departamento del CC del PTC, secretario de organizacion del Comite del PTC en la Ciudad de Pyongyang, subjefe y jefe de departamento del CC del PTC.
					
					  Desde septiembre del 99 (2010) de la Era Juche, es primer subjefe del Departamento de Organizacion y Direccion del CC del PTC.
						
					
					Kim Chang Sop, miembro suplente del Buro Politico
					
					   Nacio el 2 de enero del 35 (1946) de la Era Juche en el distrito de Unsan de la provincia de Phyong-an del Sur.
					
					  Se alisto en julio del 52 (1963) de la Era Juche en el Ejercito Popular de Corea.
					
					  Despues de graduado de la Escuela Superior del Partido Kim Il Sung, trabajo de funcionario, funcionario responsable y subjefe de seccion del CC del PTC, viceministro y subjefe de la Direccion Politica del Ministerio de Seguridad Estatal.
					
					  Desde agosto del 98 (2009) de la Era Juche, es jefe de la Direccion Politica del Ministerio de Seguridad Estatal.
						
					
					Mun Kyong Dok, miembro suplente del Buro Politico
					
					Nacio el 12 de octubre del 46 (1957) de la Era Juche en el municipio de Taesong de la ciudad de Pyongyang.
					
					Ingreso en el Ejercito Popular de Corea en octubre del 62 (1973) de la Era Juche. 
					
					Recibio el titulo de licenciado en la economia politica al graduarse de la Universidad Kim Il Sung.
					
					Trabajo de funcionario del Comite del PTC en la ciudad de Pyongyang, vicepresidente del Comite Central de la Union de la Juventud Trabajadora Socialista, director de la Direccion no.2, subjefe de departamento del CC del PTC y secretario responsable del Comite del PTC en la ciudad de Pyongyang. 
					
					Desde septiembre del 99 (2010) de la Era Juche, es secretario del CC del PTC y secretario responsable del Comite del PTC en la ciudad de Pyongyang.
					
					
					
					Kim Yang Gon, miembro suplente del Buro Politico 
					
					Nacio el 24 de abril del 31 (1942) de la Era Juche en la ciudad de Anju de la provincia de Phyong-an del Sur.
					
					Se alisto en el Ejercito Popular de Corea en agosto del 48 (1959) de la Era Juche.
					
					Al graduarse de la Universidad Kim Il Sung, obtuvo la licenciatura en la lengua y literatura francesas.
					
					Ocupo cargos de funcionario del Comite Central de la Union de la Juventud Trabajadora Socialista, funcionario, jefe de seccion, subjefe y jefe de departamento del CC del PTC. 
					
					 Desde septiembre del 99 (2010) de la Era Juche, trabaja de secretario y jefe del Departamento del Frente Unido del CC del PTC.
					
					
					
					Kim Yong Il, miembro suplente del Buro Politico
					
					Nacio el 17 de marzo del 36 (1947) de la Era Juche en la ciudad de Jongju de la provincia de Phyong-an del Norte.
					
					Despues de graduarse de la Universidad de Relaciones Internacionales, trabajo de funcionario del CC del PTC, jefe de departamento y viceministro de Relaciones Exteriores y jefe de departamento del CC del PTC.
					
					Desde septiembre del 99 (2010) de la Era Juche trabaja de secretario y jefe del Departamento Internacional del CC del PTC. 
					
					
					
					Pak To Chun, miembro suplente del Buro Politico
					
					Nacio el 9 de marzo del 33 (1944) de la Era Juche en el distrito de Rangrim de la provincia de Jagang.
					
					Se incorporo al Ejercito Popular de Corea en octubre del 49 (1960) de la Era Juche. 
					
					Despues de graduarse de la Escuela Superior del Partido Kim Il Sung, trabajo de secretario del comite del PTC en la mina, funcionario, subjefe y jefe de seccion del CC del PTC, secretario y jefe de departamento del partido provincial del PTC y secretario responsable del Comite del PTC en la provincia de Jagang.
					
					Desde septiembre del 99 (2010) de la Era Juche, trabaja de secretario del CC del PTC.
					
					
					
					Choe Ryong Hae, miembro suplente del Buro Politico
					
					Nacio el 15 de enero del 39 (1950) de la Era Juche en el distrito de Sinchon de la provincia de Hwanghae del Sur. 
					
					Ingreso en el Ejercito Popular de Corea en septiembre del 56 (1967) de la Era Juche.
					
					Al graduarse de la Universidad Kim Il Sung, obtuvo la licenciatura en la economia politica.
					
					Asumio los cargos de subjefe y jefe de departamento y vicepresidente del Comite Central de la Union de la Juventud Trabajadora Socialista, primer secretario del CC de la Union de la Juventud Socialista Kim Il Sung, subjefe de departamento del CC del PTC y secretario responsable del Comite del PTC en la provincia de Hwanghae del Norte.
					
					Desde septiembre del 99 (2010) de la Era Juche, trabaja de secretario del CC del PTC. 
					
					
					
					Jang Song Thaek, miembro suplente del Buro Politico
					
					Nacio el 22 de enero del 35 (1946) de la Era Juche en el municipio de Chong-am de la ciudad de Chongjin de la provincia de Hamgyong del Norte.
					
					Despues de graduado de la Universidad           Kim Il Sung, trabajo de funcionario del Comite del PTC en la ciudad de Pyongyang, funcionario, subjefe y jefe de seccion, subjefe, primer subjefe y jefe de departamento del CC del PTC.
					
					Desde junio del 99 (2010) de la Era Juche, es vicepresidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la RPDC y jefe del Departamento de Administracion del CC del PTC.
					
					
					
					Ju Kyu Chang, miembro suplente del Buro Politico Nacio el 25 de noviembre del 17 (1928) de la Era Juche en el distrito de Hamju de la provincia de Hamgyong del Sur.
					
					Ingreso en el Ejercito Popular de Corea en marzo del 39 (1950) de la Era Juche.
					
					Al graduarse de la universidad, obtuvo la licenciatura de ingeniero mecanico.
					
					Trabajo de vicepresidente, primer vicepresidente y presidente de la Academia de Defensa Nacional, subjefe de departamento del CC del PTC, presidente del Comite de Economia no. 2, presidente de la Academia de Ciencias Naturales no. 2 y primer subjefe de departamento del CC del PTC.
					
					A partir de septiembre del 99 (2010) de la Era Juche, es jefe del Departamento de Industria Mecanica del CC del PTC.

articles.title: Pak Kil Yon interviene en reunion anual de cancilleres del MNOAL
articles.content:
Pak Kil Yon interviene en reunion anual de cancilleres del MNOAL
						
Pyongyang, 29 de septiembre (ATCC) -- El vicecanciller Pak Kil Yon, jefe de la delegacion coreana, pronuncio un discurso en la reunion anual de cancilleres del Movimiento de los No Alineados que tuvo lugar el dia 27 durante el 65o periodo de sesiones de la Asamblea General de la ONU.
					El expuso su criterio sobre la agenda de la reunion apuntando que considera que ella refleja la voluntad comun de los paises miembros de intensificar aun mas el Movimiento de los No Alineados en la actualidad.
					
					El Movimiento de los No Alineados debera redoblar su apoyo y solidaridad a los esfuerzos de los paises miembros por defender la soberania, destaco y se refirio a la necesidad de elevar en un nivel mas alto la capacidad de accion colectiva del Movimiento en los escenarios de la ONU.
					
					El desarrollo de la situacion actual de la Peninsula Coreana causa grandes preocupaciones de los paises miembros y del mundo, recalco y prosiguio:
					
					La realidad nos hace recordar otra vez la justeza de la posesion del poderoso disuasivo de guerra y la urgencia del establecimiento del sistema para la preservacion de la paz en la Peninsula Coreana.
					
					Hemos propuesto a los paises responsables del Acuerdo de Armisticio realizar conversaciones para sustituirlo por el convenio de paz en este ano del 60o aniversario del estallido de la guerra coreana.
					
					El objetivo de nuestra propuesta esta en eliminar el factor principal que amenaza persistentemente la paz y la estabilidad de la region y establecer el sistema de preservacion de la paz duradera en la Peninsula Coreana.
					
					Por ultimo, Pak manifesto su esperanza de que los paises miembros sigan enviando firme apoyo y solidaridad a la lucha del pueblo coreano por defender la soberania del pais y el ideal principal del MNOAL comprendiendo correctamente la esencia de la grave situacion dada en la Peninsula Coreana.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il recibe cesto de flores de delegacion japonesa
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il recibe cesto de flores de delegacion japonesa 
Pyongyang, 29 de septiembre (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il recibio el cesto de flores que le dedicara la delegacion de la Sociedad Japonesa para Consulta de Asuntos Coreanos, de visita en Corea, para felicitarle por su reeleccion como Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea.
					El jefe de la delegacion Kazuyoshi Hishiki, profesor honorario de la Universidad Shudo de Hiroshima de Japon, lo entrego el dia 29 a un funcionario coreano.
					
					Este dia, fue entregado a un funcionario coreano otro cesto de flores que con el mismo motivo dedico al Dirigente Kim Jong Il Takashi Nada, presidente del comite preparatorio del departamento de Ehime para el centenario del natalicio del Presidente Kim Il Sung.
